column4: i need help please! i have an external hard disk that ubuntu identifies, but i can't create any folders on it. help!
what file system is on it?
'fdisk -l /dev/sd#' where sd# is the proper dev name of the device
has it beenused under windows befor?
then i would guess its either NTFS or VFAT for the filesystem
check out that !ntfs message/url - thers some other wiki/forum pages that discuss what going on in detail. You see the files? but cant make changes? or whats the exact problem?
Writing to a NTFS partition - is not 'safe'
writing to NTFS partitions is a 'work in progress' i hear that dapper can do it.. but no idea if it can, or how safe it is.
yep.. sounds like  best to do READ ONLY then.
backing up TO a usb ntfs - not good idea.
how about this - install that tool that lets WindowsXP read/write Ext2/3 and use XP to backup your data.
http://www.fs-driver.org/index.html
what is it running then?
Ick!
if that usb drive is NTFS then windowsme - cant read it either.
if that usb drive is VFAT then linux Can read/wriote to it.
use mount, and 'fdisk -l' and see what file system the thing is.
phrases like "not working" are sort of useless. :P
also you dident need to 'reboot' to change to the root user. (which i think you did)
oh well, okay. Are the uTorrent people planning to create uTorrent for linux?
i doubt it.
why should they. :P  go to the utorrent site and ask them. They may come out with one tomorrow for all i know.. but i wouldent hold my breath. :)
true lol
